laboratory_examinations.findings: Mycobacterium avium was identified from material collected from the right iliac lesion.
Normal antigen-specific antibody responses (tetanus toxoid and Haemophilus influenza type b) and normal in vitro T cell lymphoproliferation.
Both patients 1 and 2 were heterozygous for a 4-bp deletion (818del TTAA) in exon 6 of IFN-gR1.
